meanings.definition: A feeling of distress or unease.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm outside gave me wems.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't sleep due to the wems in her stomach.
meanings.sent3: The thought of spiders crawling on her made her wems intensify.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the cave filled him with wems.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house sent shivers of wems down her spine.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of distress or unease.
meanings.sent1: He wems whenever he has to speak in public.
meanings.sent2: The uncertainty of the situation wems her greatly.
meanings.sent3: The cat's mischievous behavior wems the dog.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline wems him to the core.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house always wems visitors with its creaking floors and dark corners.

meanings.definition: To cause distress or unease in someone.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie wems her younger brother.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news wems the entire family.
meanings.sent3: His mischievous pranks never fail to wems his friends.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the forest wems even the bravest hiker.
meanings.sent5: The ghost stories told around the campfire wems the campers as they listen intently.
